column4: I have a question about kernel options... I need to add "iommu=soft" so that I am able to use suspend/hibernate without trashing my root partition.. Now does it need to be added to the kernel line or can I just add it to the defoptions line?
I believe that it would be best if you add it to each kernel line automatically
I mean, add it yourself
what exactly is the # defoptions line for then?
defoptions only adds those lines to the default kernel, not all the other ones
what is the default kernel? i only allow 1 kernel in grub.. so should i be good?
the default kernel is the kernel automatically selected in grub. If you are only going to ever boot from that kernel then go ahead
so options like vga=792 and noapic irqpoll can all be added to defoptions? right?
correct
